content.description:
Start about 10 feet left of '

Boomer

' on a jug plate feature. Climb up and right through a sidepull. Reach and pull up to the top on some obvious jugs. Carefully downclimb easy terrain to the left (northeast).
content.location: It is on the slab on the west side of the boulder. There is a pretty obvious start hold a little lower than chest height or so.

content.description: Use compression, work straight up to a jug above, and top out.
content.location:
This is just right of '

Boomer

' around the corner on the south face. It shares the same arete for the left start hand and goes straight up.

content.description: Start on the left hand crimp in the overhanging face and a great sidepull/pinch on the arete at about head high. Gain a couple decent holds around the lip, and reel in to the jug far out right. Mantel/flop onto the slab and good holds on top. It is very fun.
content.protection: 1 big pad or 2 and a spotter.
content.location:
Start on the obvious and clean overhanging wall with a nice, featured, right hand arete. This is about 10 feet right of '

Easy Slab

' on the west side of the boulder.
